intro: Ceratanthus kerrii, commonly known as the Kerri's ceratanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
